translated: it is not even a thousand millionth of it.🔽it is not even a hundred thousand millionth of it.

original: dpe dang rgyur yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: dpe dang rgyur yang mi bzod do //
translated: it is not even a hundred thousand quintillionth of it.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang la las sems can thams cad byang chub kyi sems la bkod la /🔽byang chub sems dpa' gzhan zhig ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang la las sems can thams cad byang chub kyi sems la bkod la / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan zhig ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, suppose some bodhisattva were to establish all sentient beings in the mind of awakening.

original: stong pa nyid la mos par gyur na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mos par gyur na /
translated: And suppose another bodhisattva were to contemplate emptiness.

original: 'di ni / de bas ches grangs med par bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ni / de bas ches grangs med par bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur na /
translated: The latter would generate merit that is incalculably greater than the former.

original: gzhan mos pa skyed du 'jug pa gang yin pa dag lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gzhan mos pa skyed du 'jug pa gang yin pa dag lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to speak of those who inspire others to give rise to the mind of awakening?

original: 'di ni / de bas bsod nams ches grangs med par skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bas bsod nams ches grangs med par skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The merit they generate is incalculably greater.

original: bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa snga ma de ni; bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa 'di'i brgya'i char yang mi phod /
analyzed: bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa snga ma de ni; bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa 'di'i brgya'i char yang mi phod /
translated: The previous generation of merit does not even amount to a hundredth of this generation of merit.

original: stong gi char yang mi phod /
analyzed: stong gi char yang mi phod /
translated: it is not even a thousandth part of that,🔽it is not even a hundred thousandth part of that,

original: 'bum gyi char yang mi phod /🔽bye ba'i char yang mi phod /
analyzed: 'bum gyi char yang mi phod / bye ba'i char yang mi phod /
translated: it is not even a millionth part of that,🔽it is not even a hundred millionth part of that,🔽it is not even a thousand millionth part of that,

original: bye ba brgya'i char yang mi phod; bye ba stong gi char yang mi phod /🔽bye ba 'bum gyi char yang mi phod de /
analyzed: bye ba brgya'i char yang mi phod; bye ba stong gi char yang mi phod / bye ba 'bum gyi char yang mi phod de /
translated: it is not even a hundred thousand millionth part of that,

original: dpe dang rgyur yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: dpe dang rgyur yang mi bzod do //
translated: it is not even a hundred thousand quintillionth part of that, and it cannot be calculated by any example or illustration.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang la las byang chub sems dpa'i zan @385b bcad dam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang la las byang chub sems dpa'i zan @385b bcad dam /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if some bodhisattva were to cut off the food of a bodhisattva,

original: khros te tha na byang chub sems dpa' glang po cher skyes pa de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sangs rgyas la bskyed pa gcig bcad la /
analyzed: khros te tha na byang chub sems dpa' glang po cher skyes pa de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sangs rgyas la bskyed pa gcig bcad la /
translated: or out of anger were to cut off even a single root of virtue of a bodhisattva who had taken birth as an elephant,

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan zhig gis ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan zhig gis ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, another bodhisattva

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / don gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed kyi zan bcad de /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / don gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed kyi zan bcad de /
translated: those who follow the teachings, those who follow the meaning, those of the eighth stage, stream-enterers, once-returners, nonreturners, arhats, and pratyekabuddhas equal to the atoms in all world-realms,

original: khros nas lhung bzed dang / chos gos med par byas la /
analyzed: khros nas lhung bzed dang / chos gos med par byas la /
translated: and having become angry, deprive them of their alms bowls, robes, and so forth,

original: sems can thams cad long bar byas na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad long bar byas na /
translated: and make all sentient beings blind,

original: mi dge ba'i las 'di ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las 'di ni /
translated: this nonvirtuous karma

original: snga ma'i mi dge ba de'i brgya'i char yang mi phod pa nas dpe'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
analyzed: snga ma'i mi dge ba de'i brgya'i char yang mi phod pa nas dpe'i bar du'ang mi bzod do //
translated: is not even a hundredth, a thousandth, or a hundred thousandth part of the previous nonvirtue, and it cannot be illustrated by any analogy.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang /
translated: The Blessed One, having spoken thus, the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas,

original: nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams dang / phyogs tha dad pa nas lhags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho grangs med /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams dang / phyogs tha dad pa nas lhags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho grangs med /
translated: the garuḍas, the kinnaras, the mahoragas, Śakra, Brahmā, the world guardians, humans, non-humans, and bodhisattvas who had come from other realms.

original: tshad med pa rnams yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: They all rejoiced and praised the teachings of the Blessed One.🔽In each chapter of this great king of sūtras, the Great Cloud, there are as many gateways to the light of the Dharma as there are grains of sand in the Ganges.

original: mdo'i rgyal po chen po sprin chen po'i le'u re re la chos snang ba'i sgo stong phrag gangg'a'i klung grangs med pa'i bye ma snyed yang dag par 'du bya ba snang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dpal gyi glog gis @386a *//
analyzed: mdo'i rgyal po chen po sprin chen po'i le'u re re la chos snang ba'i sgo stong phrag gangg'a'i klung grangs med pa'i bye ma snyed yang dag par 'du bya ba snang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dpal gyi glog gis @386a *//
translated: They are all included in the splendor of the maṇḍala of light,

original: gsal bar byas pa'i le'u chen po'i tshogs mtha' yas pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed las /
analyzed: gsal bar byas pa'i le'u chen po'i tshogs mtha' yas pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed las /
translated: which illuminates the infinite collection of great chapters, as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges.

original: dga' ldan gnas pa la sogs pa 'jig rten grangs med pa dang mthun par 'jug pa'i stobs la sbyor ba'i mthu las byung bas dbang byed cing /
analyzed: dga' ldan gnas pa la sogs pa 'jig rten grangs med pa dang mthun par 'jug pa'i stobs la sbyor ba'i mthu las byung bas dbang byed cing /
translated: The power of engaging in the world in accord with the number of beings in the world, such as those in the Tushita pure land, is the power that arises from the strength of application.

original: phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho 'dus pa'i dga' ston chen po la rtse ba zhes bya ba'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa bdun pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho 'dus pa'i dga' ston chen po la rtse ba zhes bya ba'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa bdun pa rdzogs so ////
translated: This completes the thirty-seventh chapter of the great tantra of the Secret Nucleus, entitled “The Great Festival of the Ocean-Like Gathering of the Bodhisattvas of the Ten Directions.”

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po su rendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bandhe ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la bab pa /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po su rendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bandhe ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la bab pa /
translated: The Indian preceptor Surendrabodhi and the chief editor, the Venerable Yeshe De, revised the translation.
